page.title: 08KINGLEY VALE NATURE TRAIL
page.content: {Kingley Vale}is about six km N.E. of {Chichester.}The nature trail is part of a national nature reserve.It is about four km around the trail which would take about two hours to walk.The trail tells the story of the finest yew forest in Europe.Some of the yews are 500 years old but some of them are younger.There is a field museum where stuffed animals and birds can be seen. The trail goes through woodland,down- land and pasture.It is well signposted with information about the flora and fauna.On the trail is the Tansley Stone dedicated to Sir Arthur Tansley,the first chairman of the Nature Conservancy which bought the land for a nature reserve in 1952.It is thought that flint was mined on the slopes in the Stone Age. On Bow Hill are Bronze Age tumuli.
